com.rohanclan.cfml.util
Class AlertUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.rohanclan.cfml.util.AlertUtils
public class AlertUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A series of helper functions to make life easier for us to tell the user about anything that we feel like. Helper functions are available for message boxes and for displaying information on the status bar.

Author:
Stephen Milligan

Constructor Detail

AlertUtils

public AlertUtils()
Method Detail

alertUser

public static void alertUser(java.lang.Exception e)
Alerts the user to an exception. No formatting is applied to the incoming exception so what you give is what the user gets. This method also logs the exception to the console in case a developer is a-watching and wishes to view the log.

Parameters:
e - The exception to display to the user.

alertUser

public static void alertUser(java.lang.String message)
Alerts the user as to an error message. The message will be displayed with the title "Error!".

Parameters:
message - The message to display.

showStatusMessage

public static void showStatusMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                     org.eclipse.ui.IEditorPart editorPart)
Sets the status bar's message for the user for an input.

Parameters:
message - The message to display
editorPart - The editor part that wishes to display the message.

showStatusErrorMessage

public static void showStatusErrorMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                          org.eclipse.ui.IViewPart viewPart)
Sets an error status bar message for the user for an input.

Parameters:
message - The message to display
viewPart - The view part that wishes to display the message

showStatusMessage

public static void showStatusMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                     org.eclipse.ui.IViewPart viewPart)
Sets the status bar's message for the user for an input.

Parameters:
message - The message to display
viewPart - The view part that wishes to display the message.
